title: Free boundary problem
summary: In mathematics, a free boundary problem (FB problem) is a partial differential equation to be solved for both an unknown function u {\displaystyle u} and an unknown domain Ω {\displaystyle \Omega } . The segment Γ {\displaystyle \Gamma } of the boundary of Ω {\displaystyle \Omega } which is not known at the outset of the problem is the free boundary.
